column1: '''In western lands beneath the Sun''' is a poem possibly written by [[Bilbo Baggins]]. It was sung by [[Samwise Gamgee]] within the [[Tower of Cirith Ungol]] in the [[The Tower of Cirith Ungol|chapter of the same name]].
In western lands beneath the Sun
the flowers may rise in Spring
Though here at journey's end I lie
beyond all towers strong and high
above all shadows rides the Sun
I will not say the Day is done
* [[Poems in The Lord of the Rings]]
